DOC.brief_summary: Adolescent risk behaviour , violence substance use , prevalent public health concern Canada . Further , behaviours often co-occur , associated poor mental health . However , majority prevention program focus prevent single issue consider mental health , also neglect importance relationship promote positive youth development . To address gap , Centre Addiction Mental Health ( CAMH ) Centre Prevention Science design Fourth R Healthy Relationships Plus Program , small group program focus promotion positive mental health reduction violence substance use , via development improve communication , interpersonal help-seeking skill . The purpose study evaluate Fourth R Healthy Relationships Plus program use outcome ( randomize control trial design follow-up pre-test , post-test , 4 , 8 12 month ) process evaluation tool . The primary study hypothesis participation Fourth R Healthy Relationships Plus program associate positive growth treatment participant ' psychological well-being pre-test 12-month follow-up , compare control participant . In secondary analysis , study explore treatment participant report less substance use , peer violence , bully date violence 12-month follow-up control participant . Since certain person-level ( e.g. , sex , personality , executive functioning ) program-level ( e.g. , implementation quality ) variable may moderate treatment-outcome relationship , association also explore . The final hypothesis treatment participant report good attitude , knowledge assertive communication post-test compare control participant , improvement mediate association program participation 12-month outcome .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation Healthy Relationships Plus Program Youth
